feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 07 at 4:51AM AKST until February 08 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Haines Highway. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to noon AKST Tuesday.

entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches. * WHERE...Klondike Highway. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 PM AKST Tuesday.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 07 at 4:47AM AKST until February 08 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta. * WHEN...Until 9 AM AKST Tuesday.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 07 at 3:58AM AKST until February 07 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. Storm total snow accumulations of 6 to 8 inches expected. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range south of Black Rapids.

entry.title: Wind Chill Warning issued February 07 at 3:58AM AKST until February 08 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously wind chills to 65 below, and blowing snow with reduced visibility occuring. The dangerously cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Visibility will be one half mile or less at times.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 07 at 3:58AM AKST until February 09 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Low wind chills and blowing snow occurring. Plan on difficult travel conditions. In addition, areas of poor visibility are expected. Additional snow accumulations around one 1 inch are expected. * WHERE...Dalton Highway Summits and near Indian Mountain.

entry.title: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 07 at 3:49AM AKST until February 08 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. Expect wind chills to range from 40 below zero to 55 below zero. * WHERE...Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 06 at 2:56PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: An atmospheric river will move over the Gulf of Alaska and into the panhandle for the late Tuesday to Thursday time period. This will bring a period of moderate to heavy rain as the moisture band moves over panhandle. A couple of waves will move along the main moisture band and produce impulses of heavier precipitation. Precise timing and location of the heaviest precipitation over

entry.title: Flood Warning issued February 06 at 9:49PM CST until February 13 at 1:20AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Kentucky... Illinois...Indiana... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, and Shawneetown. .Recent precipitation has caused the Ohio River to rise. The river is forecast to reach flood stage at multiple locations early this week, and will remain above flood stage for the rest of the week.
